channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Location Aware Modular Biencoder for Tourism Question Answering
item.description: To overcome this, we propose treating the QA task as a dense vector retrieval problem, where we encode questions and POIs separately and retrieve the most relevant POIs for a question by utilizing embedding space similarity.

item.title: An Open and Comprehensive Pipeline for Unified Object Grounding and Detection
item.description: Grounding-DINO is a state-of-the-art open-set detection model that tackles multiple vision tasks including Open-Vocabulary Detection (OVD), Phrase Grounding (PG), and Referring Expression Comprehension (REC).

item.title: GridFormer: Point-Grid Transformer for Surface Reconstruction
item.description: Our method maximizes the spatial expressiveness of grid features and maintains computational efficiency.

item.title: Simulation-Based Inference with Quantile Regression
item.description: We present Neural Quantile Estimation (NQE), a novel Simulation-Based Inference (SBI) method based on conditional quantile regression.

item.title: Textron: Weakly Supervised Multilingual Text Detection Through Data Programming
item.description: In order to solve this problem, we propose TEXTRON, a Data Programming-based approach, where users can plug various text detection methods into a weak supervision-based learning framework.

item.title: TinyLlama: An Open-Source Small Language Model
item.description: We present TinyLlama, a compact 1. 1B language model pretrained on around 1 trillion tokens for approximately 3 epochs.

item.title: Unified Diffusion-Based Rigid and Non-Rigid Editing with Text and Image Guidance
item.description: Existing text-to-image editing methods tend to excel either in rigid or non-rigid editing but encounter challenges when combining both, resulting in misaligned outputs with the provided text prompts.

item.title: Distillation-based fabric anomaly detection
item.description: Given the extensive variability in colors, textures, and defect types, fabric defect detection poses a complex and challenging problem in the field of patterned textures inspection.

item.title: Explore Human Parsing Modality for Action Recognition
item.description: Multimodal-based action recognition methods have achieved high success using pose and RGB modality.

item.title: Spikformer V2: Join the High Accuracy Club on ImageNet with an SNN Ticket
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first time that the SNN achieves 80+% accuracy on ImageNet.

item.title: View-based Explanations for Graph Neural Networks
item.description: We propose GVEX, a novel paradigm that generates Graph Views for EXplanation.

item.title: A Robust Quantile Huber Loss With Interpretable Parameter Adjustment In Distributional Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Distributional Reinforcement Learning (RL) estimates return distribution mainly by learning quantile values via minimizing the quantile Huber loss function, entailing a threshold parameter often selected heuristically or via hyperparameter search, which may not generalize well and can be suboptimal.

item.title: DiffusionEdge: Diffusion Probabilistic Model for Crisp Edge Detection
item.description: With the recent success of the diffusion probabilistic model (DPM), we found it is especially suitable for accurate and crisp edge detection since the denoising process is directly applied to the original image size.

item.title: Leveraging SAM for Single-Source Domain Generalization in Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Domain Generalization (DG) aims to reduce domain shifts between domains to achieve promising performance on the unseen target domain, which has been widely practiced in medical image segmentation.

item.title: ClassWise-SAM-Adapter: Parameter Efficient Fine-tuning Adapts Segment Anything to SAR Domain for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Compared to conventional state-of-the-art semantic segmentation algorithms by extensive experiments, CWSAM showcases enhanced performance with fewer computing resources, highlighting the potential of leveraging foundational models like SAM for specific downstream tasks in the SAR domain.

item.title: LLaMA Pro: Progressive LLaMA with Block Expansion
item.description: Humans generally acquire new skills without compromising the old; however, the opposite holds for Large Language Models (LLMs), e. g., from LLaMA to CodeLLaMA.

item.title: BA-SAM: Scalable Bias-Mode Attention Mask for Segment Anything Model
item.description: In this paper, we reformulate this issue as a length extrapolation problem, where token sequence length varies while maintaining a consistent patch size for images of different sizes.

item.title: GUESS:GradUally Enriching SyntheSis for Text-Driven Human Motion Generation
item.description: The whole text-driven human motion synthesis problem is then divided into multiple abstraction levels and solved with a multi-stage generation framework with a cascaded latent diffusion model: an initial generator first generates the coarsest human motion guess from a given text description; then, a series of successive generators gradually enrich the motion details based on the textual description and the previous synthesized results.

item.title: Policy-regularized Offline Multi-objective Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this paper, we aim to utilize only offline trajectory data to train a policy for multi-objective RL.

item.title: Learning to Prompt with Text Only Supervision for Vision-Language Models
item.description: While effective, most of these works require labeled data which is not practical, and often struggle to generalize towards new datasets due to over-fitting on the source data.

item.title: FairGridSearch: A Framework to Compare Fairness-Enhancing Models
item.description: While there are various bias mitigation methods and base estimators in the literature, selecting the optimal model for a specific application remains challenging.

item.title: Mining Fine-Grained Image-Text Alignment for Zero-Shot Captioning via Text-Only Training
item.description: Firstly, we observe that the CLIP's visual feature of image subregions can achieve closer proximity to the paired caption due to the inherent information loss in text descriptions.

item.title: Context-Guided Spatio-Temporal Video Grounding
item.description: The key of CG-STVG lies in two specially designed modules, including instance context generation (ICG), which focuses on discovering visual context information (in both appearance and motion) of the instance, and instance context refinement (ICR), which aims to improve the instance context from ICG by eliminating irrelevant or even harmful information from the context.

item.title: Act as You Learn: Adaptive Decision-Making in Non-Stationary Markov Decision Processes
item.description: However, existing approaches for decision-making in NSMDPs have two major shortcomings: first, they assume that the updated environmental dynamics at the current time are known (although future dynamics can change); and second, planning is largely pessimistic, i. e., the agent acts ``safely'' to account for the non-stationary evolution of the environment.

item.title: Investigating the Suitability of Concept Drift Detection for Detecting Leakages in Water Distribution Networks
item.description: In this work, we explore the potential of model-loss-based and distribution-based drift detection methods to tackle leakage detection.

item.title: S$^{2}$-DMs:Skip-Step Diffusion Models
item.description: On the CIFAR10 dataset, models trained using our algorithm showed an improvement of 3. 27% to 14. 06% over models trained with traditional methods across various sampling algorithms (DDIMs, PNDMs, DEIS) and different numbers of sampling steps (10, 20, ..., 1000).

item.title: GPS-SSL: Guided Positive Sampling to Inject Prior Into Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: Any prior knowledge can now be embedded into that metric space independently from the employed DA.

item.title: Graph Neural Networks for Surfactant Multi-Property Prediction
item.description: A key factor in the predictive ability of QSPR and GNN models is the data available for training.

item.title: Prototypical Information Bottlenecking and Disentangling for Multimodal Cancer Survival Prediction
item.description: Despite advantages of multimodal learning for cancer survival prediction, massive redundancy in multimodal data prevents it from extracting discriminative and compact information: (1) An extensive amount of intra-modal task-unrelated information blurs discriminability, especially for gigapixel whole slide images (WSIs) with many patches in pathology and thousands of pathways in genomic data, leading to an ``intra-modal redundancy" issue.

item.title: Context-Aware Interaction Network for RGB-T Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Specifically, we propose a Context-Aware Complementary Reasoning (CACR) module aimed at establishing the complementary relationship between multimodal features with the long-term context in both spatial and channel dimensions.

item.title: Poisoning Attacks against Recommender Systems: A Survey
item.description: This survey paper provides a systematic and up-to-date review of the research landscape on Poisoning Attacks against Recommendation (PAR).

item.title: Large Language Model Capabilities in Perioperative Risk Prediction and Prognostication
item.description: We achieve F1 scores of 0. 50 for ASA Physical Status Classification, 0. 81 for ICU admission, and 0. 86 for hospital mortality.

item.title: Boosting of Implicit Neural Representation-based Image Denoiser
item.description: Implicit Neural Representation (INR) has emerged as an effective method for unsupervised image denoising.

item.title: ODTrack: Online Dense Temporal Token Learning for Visual Tracking
item.description: To alleviate the above problem, we propose a simple, flexible and effective video-level tracking pipeline, named \textbf{ODTrack}, which densely associates the contextual relationships of video frames in an online token propagation manner.

item.title: CRA-PCN: Point Cloud Completion with Intra- and Inter-level Cross-Resolution Transformers
item.description: Point cloud completion is an indispensable task for recovering complete point clouds due to incompleteness caused by occlusion, limited sensor resolution, etc.

item.title: A First Look at Information Highlighting in Stack Overflow Answers
item.description: For training recommendation models, we choose CNN and BERT models for each type of formatting (i. e., Bold, Italic, Code, and Heading) using the information highlighting dataset we collected from SO answers.

item.title: A Mechanistic Understanding of Alignment Algorithms: A Case Study on DPO and Toxicity
item.description: While alignment algorithms are now commonly used to tune pre-trained language models towards a user's preferences, we lack explanations for the underlying mechanisms in which models become ``aligned'', thus making it difficult to explain phenomena like jailbreaks.

item.title: Concurrent Brainstorming & Hypothesis Satisfying: An Iterative Framework for Enhanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation (R2CBR3H-SR)
item.description: Addressing the complexity of comprehensive information retrieval, this study introduces an innovative, iterative retrieval-augmented generation system.

item.title: Moonshot: Towards Controllable Video Generation and Editing with Multimodal Conditions
item.description: This work presents Moonshot, a new video generation model that conditions simultaneously on multimodal inputs of image and text.

item.title: GPT-4V(ision) is a Generalist Web Agent, if Grounded
item.description: The recent development on large multimodal models (LMMs), especially GPT-4V(ision) and Gemini, has been quickly expanding the capability boundaries of multimodal models beyond traditional tasks like image captioning and visual question answering.

item.title: Learning Prompt with Distribution-Based Feature Replay for Few-Shot Class-Incremental Learning
item.description: When progressing to a new session, pseudo-features are sampled from old-class distributions combined with training images of the current session to optimize the prompt, thus enabling the model to learn new knowledge while retaining old knowledge.

item.title: Generalist embedding models are better at short-context clinical semantic search than specialized embedding models
item.description: The increasing use of tools and solutions based on Large Language Models (LLMs) for various tasks in the medical domain has become a prominent trend.

item.title: AUPIMO: Redefining Visual Anomaly Detection Benchmarks with High Speed and Low Tolerance
item.description: Recent advances in visual anomaly detection research have seen AUROC and AUPRO scores on public benchmark datasets such as MVTec and VisA converge towards perfect recall, giving the impression that these benchmarks are near-solved.

item.title: Synthetic dataset of ID and Travel Document
item.description: This paper presents a new synthetic dataset of ID and travel documents, called SIDTD.

item.title: Evaluating Large Language Models in Semantic Parsing for Conversational Question Answering over Knowledge Graphs
item.description: Conversational question answering systems often rely on semantic parsing to enable interactive information retrieval, which involves the generation of structured database queries from a natural language input.

item.title: DGDNN: Decoupled Graph Diffusion Neural Network for Stock Movement Prediction
item.description: Moreover, the ablation study and sensitivity study further illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed method in modeling the time-evolving inter-stock and intra-stock dynamics.

item.title: Glance and Focus: Memory Prompting for Multi-Event Video Question Answering
item.description: Instead of that, we train an Encoder-Decoder to generate a set of dynamic event memories at the glancing stage.

item.title: Uncertainty Regularized Evidential Regression
item.description: The Evidential Regression Network (ERN) represents a novel approach that integrates deep learning with Dempster-Shafer's theory to predict a target and quantify the associated uncertainty.

item.title: An Invariant Information Geometric Method for High-Dimensional Online Optimization
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a full invariance oriented evolution strategies algorithm, derived from its corresponding framework, that effectively rivals the leading Bayesian optimization method in tasks with dimensions at the upper limit of Bayesian capability.

item.title: MedSumm: A Multimodal Approach to Summarizing Code-Mixed Hindi-English Clinical Queries
item.description: This work introduces the task of multimodal medical question summarization for codemixed input in a low-resource setting.
